p: Multiple system atrophy. Using homotypic ELISA assays for total o- αSyn (with antibody Syn211) or for S129-phosphorylated o- αSyn, Foulds and colleagues reported no differences in total CSF o- αSyn concentration in MSA patients ( n = 8) compared to control subjects. Of note, none of the tested groups (PD, DLB, PSP, MSA and controls) differed for total CSF αSyn, total CSF o- αSyn and CSF pS129- αSyn. However, the concentration of CSF pS129- αSyn oligomers was sharply elevated in the postmortem CSF samples of MSA patients compared to all other clinical groups [ 104]. Moreover, recent studies described that o- αSyn was abundantly distributed in neurons and oligodendrocytes in MSA brain tissues using homotypic proximity ligation assay detection [ 105].
